a.title: Nutritional Support For School Closure March 16-20

div.a: Nutritional Support For School Closure March 16-20

div.div: We appreciate all the patience and support we have received from our community during this challenging time. KISD remains committed to providing a safe learning and working environment for our students and staff. In doing our part to stop the spread of COVID-19, Kenedy ISD schools will remain closed through April 24. (Read More)
Please follow these instructions if you are having issues visiting sites on your Kenedy ISD Chromebook.

KISD has made it our number one priority to keep our students and families safe during the COVID-19 crisis. We continue to balance that priority with continuing to educate and feed students. With today's announcement that Karnes County does have a confirmed case of COVID and the announcement made by Mayor Ron Nirenberg of San Antonio to "stay at home", we have carefully reevaluated our operations and are taking immediate action to scale down staff that reports physically to work. (Read More)

KISD Parents, We will be providing many technology applications/websites for our students to utilize at home to support their learning in grades 2-12. Today we are working to update and prepare computers for check out to families (one computer per family) on Monday. Parents will need to be present to check computers out, on behalf of their children. Computers will be available for curb-side pick up and check out on Monday at the KISD Administrative Offices (Read More)

In order for us to communicate effectively with you, we need to be sure all your contact information is updated. If you have a new phone number or email address, please call us at 830-583-4100 and tell the staff member you are calling to update your phone number or email address. They will make sure the information gets to the appropriate person to update your child’s file ASAP.

We continue to actively monitor the coronavirus (COVID-19) along with our school district colleagues across the region and state, and have decided to suspend normal school operations from Monday, March 23 through Friday, April 3. During this period, all Kenedy ISD facilities will be closed for instruction, functions, events, practices and programs.
The Department of State Health Services, the World Health Organization, and Centers for Disease Control have made the following recommendations. (Click to Read)

img.alt: Nutritional Support For School Closure March 16-20
img.title: Nutritional Support For School Closure March 16-20

a.title: Nutritional Support For School Closure March 16-20

div.a: Nutritional Support For School Closure March 16-20
div.div: The Kenedy ISD understands the importance of continuing to provide nutritional support for our Lions, Leopards and Cubs during the school closure from March 16-20. We will be providing grab and go meals for ALL children who are between the ages of 1-18 in Kenedy. ALL KISD students qualify for these free meals during this emergency school closure. (Read More)

It is our responsibility to make sure you have up-to-date information when it comes to the coronavirus (COVID-19) and its impact on our District. Based on the continued spread of COVID-19 in the state of Texas, Kenedy ISD, like other area school districts, will be closed March 16-20, 2020. (read more here)
